```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
```

```{r, warning=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
```

Code to read in data, name columns, fix NA values.
```{r}
adultData <- read.delim("data/adult.data", sep =",",header = FALSE)

colnames(adultData) <- c("age", "workclass", "fnlwgt", "eductation", "education_num", "marital", "occupation", "relationship", "race", "sex", "capital_gain", "capital_loss", "hours_per_week", "native_country")

adultData[adultData == " ?"] <- NA
```

Code to explore the NAs.
```{r}
sum(is.na(adultData))

sapply(adultData, function(x) sum(length(which(is.na(x)))))
```
